Event.name: Intentionally_create
Event.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Creator</fen> creates a new entity, the <fen>Created_entity</fen>, possibly out of <fen>Components</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Creator">The Libyans</fex> were <t>generating</t> <fex name="Created_entity">arms</fex> <fex name="Purpose">for export</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the place ehere the Agent intentionally creates the new entity.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifes the Time when an Agent intentionally creates a new entity.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an Agent intentionally creates a new entity. </def-root>

Arg.name: Components
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the Components that are attached together to form a <fen>Created_entity</fen>. <ex>He <t>made</t> a jungle gym <fex name="Components">out of iron bars</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies a depictive phrase describing the actor or undergoer of an action.</def-root>

Arg.name: Created_entity
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates. <ex>They were <t>generating</t> <fex name="Created_entity">grenades</fex> for export.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the creation event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Creator</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the Means by which a Creator intentionally creates a new entity.</def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the instrument with which an Agent intentionally creates a Created_entitiy.</def-root>

Arg.name: Role
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The role of <fen>Created_entity</fen>.
<ex>This particular book was <t>created</t> <fex name="Role">as an introductory text</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Co-participant
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A secondary agent with whom the <fen>Creator</fen> intentionally creates the <fen>Created_entity</fen>.
<ex>Emily <t>set</t> <t>up</t> the business <fex name="Co-participant">with the former president of Intersoft, Inc</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: make.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: form by putting parts together or combining substances, or cause to exist or come about; bring about or perform.

lexUnit.name: creation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or process of creating

lexUnit.name: establish.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: set up on a firm or permanent basis.

lexUnit.name: set up.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: establish a business, institution, etc.

lexUnit.name: generate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to purposefully produce an entity

lexUnit.name: establishment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of establishing or being established.

lexUnit.name: generation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of producing or generating.

lexUnit.name: synthesis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the production of chemical compounds by reaction from simpler materials.

lexUnit.name: develop.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to create or make an entity

lexUnit.name: development.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the intentional creation or establishment of an entity
